protocol.name: Testosterone Optimization Protocol for Men's Health
protocol.condition_treated: Age-Related Testosterone Decline / Men's Health Optimization
protocol.overview: Evidence-based testosterone optimization protocol for men over 35 experiencing age-related decline in testosterone levels. Focuses on improving energy, muscle mass, libido, cognitive function, and overall vitality through monitored testosterone optimization. This is NOT for hypogonadism treatment but for health optimization in otherwise healthy men with suboptimal testosterone levels (300-500 ng/dL range).
evidence_sources: Men's health and testosterone optimization research

target_patient_profile.symptoms: Low energy, decreased libido, difficulty building muscle, brain fog, mood changes

steps.title: Initial Men's Health Assessment
steps.description: Comprehensive evaluation of symptoms, lifestyle factors, and current health status. Assess motivation and goals for testosterone optimization.
clinical_scales: ADAM Questionnaire (Androgen Deficiency in Aging Males)

symptoms: Muscle mass and body composition changes

steps.title: Baseline Laboratory Panel
steps.description: Comprehensive hormone and safety labs obtained in morning (7-9 AM fasting) to establish baseline testosterone levels and rule out contraindications.
lab_tests_required: Thyroid Panel (TSH, Free T3, Free T4)
steps.notes: Two separate morning measurements recommended if initial total testosterone is 300-500 ng/dL to confirm consistent suboptimal levels

steps.title: Assess Testosterone Optimization Candidacy
steps.description: Evaluate lab results and determine if patient is a candidate for testosterone optimization therapy.

branch_outcomes.rationale: Patient is good candidate for testosterone optimization with standard monitoring
Patient is candidate but requires more frequent monitoring due to age
Clinical hypogonadism detected - needs specialist evaluation, not optimization protocol
Testosterone in normal range - focus on lifestyle optimization first
Elevated hematocrit is contraindication - must be addressed before testosterone therapy
Elevated PSA requires urological evaluation before testosterone therapy

steps.title: Treatment Education and Protocol Selection
steps.description: Educate patient on testosterone optimization, discuss delivery methods, set expectations, and select optimal protocol based on lifestyle and preferences.
education_topics: How testosterone affects energy, muscle, mood, libido, and cognition
Difference between optimization and medical replacement
Delivery method options: injections vs topical vs pellets
Expected timeline for results (2-6 weeks for energy, 3-6 months for body composition)

protocol_options.name: Injectable (Testosterone Cypionate)
protocol_options.dosing: 100-200 mg weekly or 50-100 mg twice weekly

steps.title: Select Initial Dosing Protocol
steps.description: Determine starting dose based on baseline testosterone, age, weight, and delivery method preference.

branch_outcomes.dosing_instructions: 100 mg testosterone cream applied daily to shoulders/arms
75 mg testosterone cream applied daily to shoulders/arms

steps.title: Treatment Initiation
steps.description: Begin testosterone optimization therapy with selected protocol. Provide patient education on administration technique (if injectable), safety precautions, and symptom tracking.
patient_education: When to contact provider (side effects, concerns)

steps.title: 6-Week Follow-up Labs and Adjustment
steps.description: First follow-up to assess response, check safety labs, and adjust dose if needed. Most men start noticing improvements in energy and libido by this point.
lab_tests_required: Total Testosterone (trough for injectables, any time for topical)

steps.title: Dose Adjustment Decision
steps.description: Based on 6-week labs and clinical response, determine if dose adjustment is needed.

branch_outcomes.rationale: Testosterone levels below optimal - increase by 20-25%
branch_outcomes.action: Increase weekly dose by 20-25 mg if injectable, or increase cream by 25%

branch_outcomes.rationale: Testosterone in optimal range with good clinical response

branch_outcomes.action: Decrease weekly dose by 20-25 mg if injectable

branch_outcomes.rationale: Estradiol elevated (>40 pg/mL) - add low-dose anastrozole to prevent aromatization
branch_outcomes.action: Add anastrozole 0.25 mg twice weekly, maintain testosterone dose

branch_outcomes.rationale: Limited symptom improvement despite optimal levels - evaluate other factors
branch_outcomes.action: Review lifestyle factors, sleep, stress, thyroid function. May need non-hormonal interventions

steps.title: 12-Week Optimization Check
steps.description: Assess treatment response and fine-tune protocol. Most men should be at optimal levels and experiencing significant benefits by this point.
clinical_assessment: Body composition changes (muscle gain, fat loss)

optimization_targets.energy: Reported improvement in daily energy and reduced afternoon fatigue
optimization_targets.muscle: Easier muscle gain, improved gym performance
optimization_targets.mood: Improved mood stability and reduced irritability

steps.title: Lifestyle Optimization Consultation
steps.description: For patients who don't qualify for testosterone therapy or need additional support - focus on natural optimization through lifestyle interventions.

recommendations: Adequate protein intake (1g per lb body weight)
Healthy fats (omega-3, saturated fat from quality sources)
Micronutrients: Zinc (30mg), Magnesium (400mg), Vitamin D (5000 IU)
Maintain slight caloric surplus if building muscle
7-9 hours of quality sleep per night
Avoid excessive heat exposure to testicles

steps.retest_schedule: Repeat labs in 3 months after lifestyle optimization

steps.title: Quarterly Maintenance Labs
steps.description: Ongoing monitoring for men on long-term testosterone optimization. Quarterly labs for first year, then twice yearly if stable.

monitoring_targets.psa: Monitor for changes >0.3 ng/mL per year

steps.title: Annual Comprehensive Review
steps.description: Yearly comprehensive assessment of testosterone optimization outcomes, benefits vs risks analysis, and protocol adjustments.
comprehensive_assessment: Evaluate quality of life changes (validated questionnaires)
Body composition changes (DEXA scan if available)
Discuss continuation vs modification vs discontinuation
lab_tests_required: Full hormone panel (testosterone, free T, SHBG, estradiol, LH, FSH)

safety_checks.rationale: These conditions are absolute contraindications to testosterone therapy
Elevated hematocrit increases risk of blood clots
Elevated PSA requires evaluation before testosterone therapy

safety_checks.monitoring_required: Increased monitoring frequency recommended for men over 65
safety_checks.rationale: Older men have higher baseline cardiovascular and prostate cancer risk

clinical_notes.patient_selection: This protocol is designed for otherwise healthy men over 35 with age-related testosterone decline (300-500 ng/dL). It is NOT for clinical hypogonadism (<300 ng/dL), which requires different management.
clinical_notes.goals: Optimize testosterone to upper-normal range (700-900 ng/dL) to improve energy, muscle mass, libido, mood, and cognitive function while maintaining safety through regular monitoring.
clinical_notes.typical_patient_profile: 45-year-old man with fatigue, decreased libido, difficulty building muscle despite exercise, total testosterone 380 ng/dL. Wants to feel like he did in his 30s.
clinical_notes.success_metrics: 70-80% of patients report significant improvements in energy, libido, muscle mass, and overall quality of life within 3-6 months
